"Acrobat" is my ace in the hole, giving a X3 Mult on the *final* hand of this round. And lastly, I have the "Midas Mask," which turns played face cards into Gold cards; I also get $3 if I hold it at the end of the round.

Here are the cards in my hand: 4 of Spades, 8 of Hearts, Queen of Clubs (Uh oh! Face card.), 10 of Clubs, Ace of Diamonds, 7 of Diamonds, 6 of Diamonds, and 5 of Diamonds.

Since I have 2 hands remaining, I need a strategy:

1.  Play the penultimate hand (Hand 1 of 2) to build up Ride the Bus to +17.
2.  Play the final hand (Hand 2 of 2) with the X3 Mult from Acrobat to get a big score.

I don't need to win with this first hand, but I *must* avoid playing the Queen of Clubs. I'll shoot for a High Card hand.

I'm aiming for a level 3 High Card, with a base of 25 chips and a base multiplier of 3. My plan is to use the 4 of Spades, which is position 1. This should give me: (25 base + 4) * (3 base + 16 Ride the Bus) = 29 * 19 = 551 chips. With this play, my total will be 1569 chips.

This means I'll need approximately 431 chips in the final hand. With Acrobat's X3 Mult triggering then, my total multiplier will be: (3 base + 17 Ride the Bus) * 3 Acrobat = 20 * 3 = 60 Mult. 431 / 60 = 7.18. Any card with a value of 8 or higher should win comfortably!

Let's make sure my logic is sound.

I'm thinking, if I play a card that doesn't score, does it reset? No! "Ride the Bus gains +1 Mult per consecutive hand played without a scoring face card". If I play High Card (4 of Spades), the 4 is the only card that scores. The Queen in hand does not score. Thus, Ride the Bus increases.

I should verify Midas Mask again: "All played face cards become Gold cards when scored." If I play the Queen, it becomes Gold but resets Ride the Bus. I don't want to reset Ride the Bus. I'll keep the Queen in hand.

*One more check*: Do I need to discard? I have 3 discards. I could discard the Queen to find more low cards, but I only have 2 hands left, so I might as well just play the penultimate hand now.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
play <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Play the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may play up to 5 cards at a time. If you play a hand, you must also respond with the intended hand type you think you are playing, and an estimate of the number of chips you think you will earn from the hand. Use the results of previous hands played to inform your estimate.
discard <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Discard the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may discard up to 5 cards at a time.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.

**Analysis: The Final Hand**

Okay, here's the situation. I'm on the small blind, with 1598 chips, needing to hit 2000 â€“ so, 402 more. This is the last hand, and I have 3 discards available. I've got a +3 ante to consider as well. My hand contains an 8 of Hearts, a 2 of Hearts, the Queen of Clubs (a face card!), a 10 of Clubs, the Ace of Diamonds, a 7 of Diamonds, a 6 of Diamonds, and a 5 of Diamonds.

I've got three Jokers in play: "Ride the Bus" currently at +17 Multiplier (crucial for next round), "Acrobat" which will triple the multiplier on this final hand, and "Midas Mask" (Negative edition) which turns face cards into gold cards and awards $3 if held in hand at the end of the round. It also gives +1 Joker slot, but that's not relevant.

My priority is the win, and setting up the next round optimally. I have the following hand options: High Card (Level 3 - 25 base chips, 3 mult), Flush (Level 2 - 50 base chips, 6 mult), Pair (Level 1 - 10 base chips, 2 mult), and Straight (Level 1 - 30 base chips, 4 mult).

To calculate the best play, I must remember the "Ride the Bus" rule - it resets if a face card is played. Playing the Queen of Clubs is off the table, as much as I want the Midas bonus. High Card looks promising for getting me over the threshold.

If I play High Card with the Ace of Diamonds, the calculation is (25 + 11) * (3 + 17) * 3 = 2160 chips. With the 8 of Hearts, it's (25 + 8) * 60 = 1980 chips. Both easily cover what I need. Given the 8 of Hearts is the lower card, there is no value in playing it instead of the Ace.

I've confirmed the math on previous turns to make sure it's all correct. The final hand will have Ride the Bus at +17, and Acrobat will triple the multiplier on the last hand. High Card is the way to go.

So, I will play the Ace of Diamonds as a High Card. The total chips will be 2160. This comfortably clears the 402 target, and keeps the Ride the Bus +17 multiplier.

I will also do a quick look at the Midas Mask card: This could be useful in future rounds, but since preserving the +17 Mult is key, it's irrelevant on this hand.

Therefore, the play is: Position \[5] (Ace of Diamonds) to play a "high card" hand, generating 2160 chips.
